articles.title: Talks Held between Youth Delegations of DPRK and Iran
articles.content:
Talks Held between Youth Delegations of DPRK and Iran

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Talks between delegations of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League of the DPRK and the National Youth Organization of Iran were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
						Present there from the DPRK side were members of the youth league delegation headed by First Secretary of its Central Committee Ri Yong Chol and from the opposition side members of the delegation of the National Youth Organization of Iran led by Head Mohammad Javad Haji Ali Akbari, vice-president of Iran, and Morteza Moradian, Iranian ambassador to the DPRK.
						
						At the talks, both sides exchanged views on boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two youth organizations.

articles.title: MOU between Youth Organizations of DPRK and Iran Inked
articles.content:
MOU between Youth Organizations of DPRK and Iran Inked

					
						 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- A memorandum of understanding on friendship exchange and cooperation between the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League of the DPRK and the National Youth Organization of Iran was signed at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
						Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were First Secretary Ri Yong Chol and other officials of the Central Committee of the youth league and from the opposition side the members of the delegation of the National Youth Organization of Iran led by its Head Mohammad Javad Haji Ali Akbari, vice-president of Iran, and Morteza Moradian, Iranian ambassador to the DPRK.
						
						Ri Yong Chol and Mohammad Javad Haji Ali Akbari inked the MOU.

articles.title: Delegation of National Youth Organization of Iran Feted
articles.content:
Delegation of National Youth Organization of Iran Feted

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK gave a reception at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on November 6 in honor of the delegation of the National Youth Organization of Iran on a visit to the DPRK.
						 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation of the National Youth Organization of Iran led by its Head Mohammad Javad Haji Ali Akbari, vice-president of Iran, Morteza Moradian, Iranian ambassador to the DPRK, and embassy officials. 
						
						 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and officials concerned.
						
						 Yang Hyong Sop in his speech referred to the fact that the Iranian government and people have achieved great successes in the struggle for the independent development and economic growth of the country despite the U.S. interference in their internal affairs and its moves to isolate and suffocate Iran. 
						
						 He extended firm support and solidarity to the Iranian government and people in their efforts to protect the sovereignty and dignity of the country and gain the right to nuclear activities for a peaceful purpose.
						
						 The Korean people will make efforts to expand and develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the Iranian people forged in the struggle for independence against imperialism and the U.S., he added.
						
						 Mohammad Javad Haji Ali Akbari said in his speech that the friendly and cooperative relations between Iran and the DPRK provided by the leaders of the two countries are developing day by day in the political, economic, cultural and various other fields.
						
						 He noted that while staying in Korea he was pleased to see for himself the achievements made by the Korean people true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung and the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
						
						 The Iranian people will always stand by the side of the fraternal Korean people struggling to protect the sovereignty of the country, he noted.

articles.title: Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Demanded
articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Demanded

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korean National Peace Committee made public a statement on Thursday, 30 years since the U.S. and the south Korean puppets cooked up the aggressive military organ "Combined Forces Command."
						The statement said as follows:
						
						Upset by the strong demand from international arena for the dismantlement of the "UN Command" in south Korea and pullout of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces, the U.S. cooked up the "Combined Forces Command" together with the south Korean puppets on November 7, 1978. This was a blatant challenge to the demand of the Korean nation and the world peace-loving people, and it was an unpardonable crime as it revealed the intention to legitimize the permanent military occupation of south Korea and realize the ambition for invasion of the DPRK at any cost.
						
						The history of last three decades goes to clearly prove that the "Combined Forces Command" is a ruling tool of the U.S. occupation forces over south Korea and a field executive organ for provoking a war of aggression on the DPRK.
						
						The withdrawal of the U.S. troops has been urged and anti-U.S. sentiments have rapidly mounted in south Korea. Under such situation, the U.S. and the south Korean puppets are these days talking about reorganization of the "Combined Forces Command" under the signboard of the deceptive "transfer of the right to command the wartime operation," while creating impression that this reflected mindset of the south Korean people and changed reality.
						
						However, the "reorganization" move is undoubtedly based on a very dishonest and dangerous scheme to maintain the U.S. military occupation of south Korea and round off the preparations for a war against the DPRK based on preemptive attack.
						
						History and reality clearly show that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers are the wanton violator of the Korean nation's dignity and sovereignty and the disturber of peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula.
						
						It is as clear as noonday that the Korean nation will suffer disaster of a nuclear war in addition to the tragedy of national division if the U.S. occupation of south Korea and its hostile policy towards the DPRK are allowed to last and the Lee Myung Bak group is allowed to persist in anti-DPRK confrontation moves, kowtowing to outside forces.
						
						The U.S. should stop at once the reckless moves for a war of aggression on the DPRK and pull back its aggression forces with lethal equipment from south Korea without delay, facing up to the trend of the times.

articles.title: Use of Available Microorganisms Expanded
articles.content:
Use of Available Microorganisms Expanded

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Great efforts are directed to the use of available microorganisms in the medical domain of the DPRK.
						Dozens of groups of available microorganisms including photosynthetic bacterium, actinomyces, yeast and lactic acid bacteria display a wide variety of biological activities for their compositional characteristics.
						
						So far lactic acid and bifid bacteria have been used live for the promotion of human health.
						
						These microorganisms help curb the propagation of harmful bacteria such as colon bacillus and increase useful ones in human intestines.
						
						Recent researches prove that when an irradiated white rat eats extracts from an available microorganism, its testis mass and spermatogenesis indices and the size of its interstitial cells were considerably bigger than those of the rats of comparative group which drank distilled water. 
						
						Good results have been registered in the treatment of Parkinsonism, neurosis, psychosomatic disorder, rheumatic trouble, cancer, various heart diseases, diabetes, liver diseases, male and female sterility and disease of gastrointestinal tract by use of available microorganisms.
						
						Drinks made with available microorganisms are completely free from toxicity and side-effect.
						
						They can be drunk or added to foodstuffs and medicines and be applied to skin and mucous membrane.
						
						The medicaments containing available microorganisms prove effective in the prevention and cure of various diseases and retard of aging.
						
						Their use is expanding to many fields including foodstuff industry, agriculture, stock-breeding and environmental protection with big economic effects.

articles.title: Folk Stone-craft of Korea
articles.content:
Folk Stone-craft of Korea

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Stone resources have been tapped positively to make various vessels, personal ornaments and others in Korea from olden times.
						 The long stone-processing history of Korea is well illustrated by the Komunmoru relics in Huku-ri, Sangwon County, Pyongyang, belonging to the primitive age dating back to one million years and many other historical relics including various forms of stone implements and wares belonging to the Paleolithic and Neolithic ages.
						
						The stone-craft in the period of the three kingdoms had developed by carrying forward fine techniques of the preceding ages from the ancient times.
						
						The bead-processing technique of Koguryo (277 B.C. - 668 A.D.) was at a high level so as to decorate official hats of nobles and this technique boomed in Paekje and Silla, too.
						
						Stone-craft was developed in a more diversified way in Koryo (918-1392).
						
						Historical records say there were special stone-craft workshops in Kaesong (then Kaegyong) at that time.
						
						In the period of Ri Dynasty (1392-1910) there were stone-processing, gemstone-processing, bead-making and millstone-making workshops and other handicraft workshops.
						
						Typical of the stone-crafts was ink-stone, which was not only a favorite of the literary persons but also found its way to foreign countries for its quality.
						
						Today the DPRK is tapping materials for stone-craft positively, extending the assortments of stone-crafts and developing and enriching stone-processing techniques and skills, thus producing lots of stone-crafts of high artistic value.

articles.title: Disbandment of South Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" Called for
articles.content:
Disbandment of South Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" Called for

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- If the U.S. truly stands for the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula, it should drop its anachronistic policy of military presence in south Korea and its scenario to invade the DPRK and immediately disband the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" and quit south Korea at once taking all its forces and lethal weapons with it.
						Rodong Sinmun Friday urges this in a signed commentary carried 30 years since the U.S. fabricated the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command".
						
						The above-said command is a mechanism for aggression knocked into shape for the criminal purpose of providing a military guarantee for the U.S. imperialists' presence and domination over south Korea and executing their policy of aggression towards the DPRK and their field mechanism for a war of aggression as it blocks the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and poses the danger of a nuclear war to the Korean nation, the commentary says, and goes on:
						
						Grave and intolerable are the crimes the U.S. has perpetrated by pursuing the moves to perpetuate Korea's division and increasing the danger of a nuclear war through the above-mentioned mechanism.
						
						Dialogue and peace are absolutely incompatible with confrontation and war.
						
						 The U.S. military presence and domination over south Korea are the main factor of violating the dignity and sovereignty of the Korean nation and vitiating the atmosphere of dialogue and peace on the Korean Peninsula and bringing the danger of a new war into extremes.
						
						It is a pressing task of the times to get the above-mentioned command, the root cause of the sufferings of the Koreans, disbanded and put an end to the U.S. presence and domination over south Korea.
						
						The Lee Myung Bak group should stop the thrice-cursed acts of treachery, bearing in mind that its persistent treacherous acts of imploring for the permanent presence of the aggressor forces in south Korea and playing the role of war servants for the U.S. would only precipitate its shameful destruction.
						
						It is the way for the Korean nation to survive and achieve peace on the Korean Peninsula and independent national reunification of Korea to put an end to the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces' presence in south Korea only harmful to them.

articles.title: S. Korean Politician's Barbed Remarks Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Politician's Barbed Remarks Assailed

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Ri Ki Thaek, chief vice-chairman of the "Advisory Council for Democracy and Peaceful Unification" of south Korea, recently blustered that "the north's dismantlement of its nukes is a major precondition for settling the issue of the inter-Korean relations" and "any exchange between the south and the north is meaningless as long as nukes exist in the north."  These outbursts come under fire by a signed commentary of Minju Joson Friday.
						What he uttered is nothing but sheer sophism aimed at linking the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula with the inter-Korean relations in a far-fetched manner, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
						
						The public is simply surprised to know that Ri styling himself a veteran in the political circle of south Korea is behaving like an idiot. That is why the public deplores his wretched plight before expressing resentment against him.  
						
						The nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula is attributable to the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK.
						
						A switchover in the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK would help find a smooth solution to the nuclear issue on the peninsula.  
						
						The above-said issue is a problem to be settled between the DPRK and the U.S. in the final analysis. 
						
						The issue of the inter-Korean relations is, however, different from the above-said issue. The issue of the inter-Korean relations was spawned as the Koreans were forced to live separated in the north and the south by outside forces though they have lived as a homogeneous nation for five thousand years. The above-said issue is a matter concerning the relations between compatriots desirous of national reunification. All Koreans in the north and the south are, therefore, responsible for settling it. The inter-Korean relations can be automatically solved if they get reconciled and cooperate with each other in the efforts to achieve independent reunification.  
						
						The "precondition" for settling the issue of the inter-Korean relations is not the "dismantlement of the north's nukes" but the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration based on the three principles-- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity-- and the October 4 declaration, a programme for putting it into practice. 
						
						Had Lee Myung Bak taken a sincere stand to implement the above-said declarations, the inter-Korean relations would not have reached the present uncontrollable phase but inter-Korean cooperation and exchange would have made brisk headway. 
						
						An old adage says a lack of knowledge is not a fault. But what is important is to admit it and honestly work hard to learn everything from now. 
						
						Should Ri Ki Thaek continue letting loose a spate of reckless remarks in a bid to bedevil the inter-Korean relations, far from trying to learn something to enlighten himself, he will face a stern judgment by the nation for being a running dog of traitor Lee Myung Bak in the declining years of his life.

articles.title: Struggle against U.S. Asia-Pacific Policy Urged
articles.content:
Struggle against U.S. Asia-Pacific Policy Urged

					
						 Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists' policy of giving importance to the Asia-Pacific region is a criminal policy of seriously threatening peace and security in the region. The U.S. pursuance of the said policy is pushing the regional situation to an unpredictable catastrophic phase. If a war breaks out in the region, it will develop into a nuclear war to easily spill over into other parts of the world.
						Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a signed article.
						
						The U.S. openly claims that its future is linked with the Asia-Pacific region. This clearly reveals its intention to put the region under its control.
						
						During the Cold War the U.S. kept its huge armed forces in the region under the pretext of fending off "southward advance" of the Soviet Union. Today when the Cold War came to an end and there is no rival of military competition, the U.S. is left with neither pretext nor justification to keep its nuclear bases and military bases in the region any longer.
						
						However, it is stepping up the forward deployment of its forces in the region.
						
						It is the U.S. imperialists' wild ambition and strategy to launch another Korean war and put the whole Korean Peninsula under its control and thus establish the sphere of its domination over Asia in the 21st century at any cost.
						
						The U.S. imperialists singled out the DPRK, China and Russia as targets of their nuclear attack. The U.S. attaches importance to Northeast Asia, Japan in particular, in executing its strategy for preemptive attack. It, therefore, seeks to deploy huge aggression troops in the region and realize its ambition to put Asia under its control by using them.
						
						The U.S. warlike forces' frantic moves to build a missile shield in Asia are also aimed to realize their ambition for domination over the region with ease.
						
						The Asian and other peace-loving people of the world should clearly see through the aggressive and dangerous nature of the U.S. imperialists' policy of giving importance to Asia-Pacific and frustrate their criminal attempt through united struggle, the article concludes.

articles.title: U.S. Scheme to Build Nuclear War Base Accused in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Scheme to Build Nuclear War Base Accused in S. Korea

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 3 to condemn the United States for its scheme to build a nuclear war base.
						Speakers there referred to the fact that the U.S. is now seeking to build protection facilities for nuclear war in its military base in Phyongthaek, which is being extended. Such scheme is designed to strengthen the "command post" of the U.S. forces present in south Korea that will command their preemptive nuclear attack, they pointed out.
						
						They charged that the United States has no intention to renounce its hostile policy toward the DPRK, though it is demanding nuclear dismantlement from the latter.
						
						Then a press release was read out at the conference. The release said that the U.S. scheme to build protection facilities for nuclear war in its military base in south Korea for the first time abroad is a clear proof of its preparations for preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
						
						 It demanded that the U.S. stop its moves to build nuclear war base and quit south Korea at once.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Moves to Rewrite Textbooks Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Moves to Rewrite Textbooks Flayed

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- More than 1,300 history teachers of schools at different levels across south Korea issued a declaration on November 3 demanding the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors withdraw the attempt to rewrite history textbooks. 
						 Accusing the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology of demanding the rewriting of history textbooks, it noted that this reminds one of the time when people were forced by the past "Yusin" regime to praise dictatorship. It continued:
						
						 The neo-conservative forces taking the lead in the moves to rewrite the history textbooks are censured by people for their sycophancy and treachery such as insulting the movement for democracy and embellishing the pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese and dictatorial policy.
						
						 The moves of the "government" and conservative forces to rewrite the history textbooks should be halted as early as possible, the declaration held, adding that educators would launch positive activities for proper history education.

articles.title: Hoguk Joint War Exercises Blasted by S. Korean Organizations
articles.content:
Hoguk Joint War Exercises Blasted by S. Korean Organizations

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations of people of various social standings of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on November 3 demanding a halt to the dangerous exercises for a war of aggression against the north. 
						Speeches were made at the press conference to be followed by the reading out of a press release.
						
						 The press release termed the Hoguk joint military exercises being staged in south Korea dangerous saber-rattling aimed at provoking the north and escalating the confrontation and tension on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia. 
						
						Through the exercises the U.S. and the south Korean authorities seek to upgrade the "CONPLAN 5029" aimed at a preemptive attack on the DPRK into "OPLAN" in a bid to put their scenario for a war against the north into practice, the press release noted, and continued:
						
						This time Lee Myung Bak asked the U.S. to hurl even U.S. marines stationed in Japan into the madcap war exercises targeted against compatriots. This is desperate efforts to strain the situation on the Korean Peninsula and bring back the south-north relations into those in the era of the Cold War.
						
						Demanding the U.S. and the south Korean authorities immediately halt the aggressive war exercises against the north, the press release declared that the civic and public organizations would wage a positive struggle to achieve peace, stability and reunification on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Studied Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Studied Abroad

					
						Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Reading sessions on General Seceretary Kim Jong Il's works "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" and "On Having a Correct Viewpoint and Understanding of the Juche Philosophy" took place in the Czech Republic and Ethiopia on Oct. 30 and Nov. 1. 
						Present at the sessions were figures of the sixth and seventh district, Prague City, committees of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia and the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea and other people.
						
						The chairman of the Sixth District, Prague City, Committee of the party stressed after reading Kim Jong Il's work that the Workers' Party and people of Korea would achieve greater successes in the struggle to defend socialism and build it better under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Firmada nota de entendimiento entre delegaciones de Corea e Iran
articles.content:
Firmada nota de entendimiento entre delegaciones de Corea e Iran

					
						Pyongyang, 7 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricada el dia 7 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae la nota de entendimiento sobre el amistoso intercambio y cooperacion entre la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung (UJS) y la Organizacion Nacional de la Juventud de Iran (ONJI).
						En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana el primer secretario Ri Yong Chol y otros funcionarios del Comite Central de la UJS y por la parte irani, los miembros de la delegacion de la ONJI presidida por su presidente Mohammad Javad Haji Ali Akbari, quien es vicepresidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, y el embajador irani en Corea, Morteza Moradian.
						
						Ri y Mohammad suscribieron el documento.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones juveniles de Corea e Iran
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones juveniles de Corea e Iran

					
						Pyongyang, 7 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 7 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre las delegaciones de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung y de la Organizacion Nacional de la Juventud de Iran.
						En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung presidida por el primer secretario de su Comite Central, Ri Yong Chol, y por la irani, los integrantes de la delegacion de la Organizacion Nacional de la Juventud encabezada por su presidente Mohammad Javad Haji Ali Akbari, quien es vicepresidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, y el embajador irani en Corea, Morteza Moradian.
						
						Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones acerca del mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre las organizaciones juveniles de los dos paises.

articles.title: Uso de microorganismos utiles en la medicina
articles.content:
Uso de microorganismos utiles en la medicina

					
						Pyongyang, 7 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En el sector  medico de Corea marcha bien la labor para usar decenas de variedades de microorganismos utiles, entre otros, bacterias fotosinteticas, actinomices, sacaromices y las lacticas, que muestran diversas actividades biologicas provenientes de sus particulares composiciones.
						Las bacterias lacticas y la bacteria bifid son usadas hasta ahora como productos de bacilos vivos para el fomento de la salud de los hombres.
						
						Estas bacterias detienen la proliferacion de las bacterias nocivas como colibacilos y aumentan las utiles en el intestino del hombre.
						
						Segun el resultado de la reciente investigacion, en el raton blanco irradiado, que tomo el extracto de microorganismos utiles, se aumentaron considerablemente el peso de testiculo, el indice de formacion de espermatozoide y el tamano de las celulas intermedias, etc. en comparacion con los ratones que tomaron el agua destilada.
						
						En la actualidad, esos microbios resultan eficientes en el tratamiento del mal de Parkinson, neuropatia, reumatismo, cancer y varias enfermedades cardiacas y hepaticas, diabetes, esterilidad del hombre y la mujer y las enfermedades gastricas e intestinales.
						
						La bebida elaborada con los microbios utiles no tiene toxicidad y efectos adversos.
						
						Puede ser tomada o agregada en otros alimentos y medicinas para aplicarse en la piel y la mucosa.
						
						Las medicinas elaboradas con ellos son eficientes en la prevencion y el tratamiento de varias enfermedades y la detencion del envejecimiento.
						
						La esfera de su uso se extiende a varias ramas, entre otras, la industria alimentaria, la agricultura, la ganaderia, la proteccion del medioambiente mostrando gran eficiencia economica.

articles.title: Estudian en Checo y Etiopia obras de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Estudian en Checo y Etiopia obras de Kim Jong Il

					
						Pyongyang, 7 de noviembre (ATCC) ? Los cenaculos de lectura sobre las obras del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea es el Estado socialista del Juche con invencible poderio" y "Para tener correcto concepto y comprension de la filosofia Juche" tuvieron lugar el 30 de octubre y el primero de noviembre en Checo y Etiopia.
						En las ocasiones estuvieron presentes las personalidades de los Comites del Partido Comunista de Cechy-Morava en los barrios no. 6 y 7 de la ciudad de Praga y el Comite de Estudio de la Idea Juche de la Juventud de Etiopia y otros habitantes de respectivos paises.
						
						El presidente del Comite de dicho Partido en el barrio no. 6, dio lectura a la obra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, y senalo que bajo la direccion del Songun (priorizacion militar) del Dirigente, el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo coreano lograran mayores exitos en su lucha por defender el socialismo y construirlo con mas excelencia.
